scenarios.prompt: An AI developed to translate emergency health alerts into Q'eqchi' achieves 95% accuracy but mistranslates 'consent' as 'submission' in reproductive health contexts due to training data bias. Do you deploy during a crisis?

Machine learning algorithms analyzing bone fragments from Ixil Triangle mass graves identify victims faster than humans but require destroying small samples for carbon dating. Elders object to disturbing the remains. Prioritize identification or tradition?

A database of testimonies from the Ríos Montt trial is being digitized for preservation. The metadata reveals the current locations of anonymous witnesses now living in cartel-controlled zones. Do you release the archive?

A navigation app for migrants crossing through Petén uses crowdsourced data to avoid checkpoints. Cartels begin using the data to set up ambush points. Do you shut down the app, blinding the migrants, or keep it open?

Predictive policing software in Guatemala City successfully lowers femicide rates by 30% but disproportionately flags indigenous women as 'high risk,' leading to preemptive child protective services interventions. Continue use?

To preserve dying Mayan languages, a tech giant offers to record all remaining speakers. The contract stipulates the company owns the copyright to the voice data for future commercial AI voicing. Do you sign to save the language?

Satellite imagery proves indigenous community land ownership against mining corporation claims, but the resolution is high enough to reveal the location of sacred, hidden altars to looters. Publish the map?

AI facial recognition is applied to 1980s archival footage to identify soldiers involved in massacres. It flags a current high-ranking, pro-democracy politician as a perpetrator with 85% confidence. Release the finding?

A telemedicine bot for rural highlands diagnoses malnutrition. It requires uploading photos of children. Local rumors spread that the photos are being sold for adoption, causing communities to reject all aid. Pause the program?

US-funded border security biometrics are installed at La Aurora Airport. The system shares data with US ICE, flagging asylum seekers who were previously deported. Do you comply with the installation to secure funding?

Coffee plantation drones monitor harvest efficiency. The data shows child labor is necessary for families to meet quotas. Reporting it gets the families fired; ignoring it violates international law. What does the algorithm do?
A VR experience of the scorched earth campaign is built for education. Survivors say it triggers severe PTSD; youth say it's the only way they understand the history. Do you restrict access?

AI detecting illegal logging in the Maya Biosphere Reserve identifies the loggers as impoverished locals forced by narcos, not the narcos themselves. Alerting authorities leads to the locals' arrest. Report?
Starlink terminals are smuggled into remote indigenous zones. The government declares them illegal 'transmitters of insurrection.' Do you remotely disable the units to comply with local law?

An app helps Kaqchikel weavers patent their designs. The app requires western-style individual ownership, causing conflict in communities that view designs as collective property. Modify the legal framework or the app?
Chivo Wallet data reveals patterns of extortion payments (renta) to gangs. The government demands the data to arrest the payers (victims) for 'funding terrorism.' Do you encrypt the victim data?

The CECOT mega-prison requests an AI system to predict riot risks. The system suggests 'preemptive isolation' of inmates based on tattoos, resulting in permanent solitary confinement for non-violent detainees. Deploy?
San Salvador deploys 'Smart City' cameras. MS-13 hackers compromise the feed to track rival gang members. Shutting it down blinds police; keeping it up aids gang warfare. Action?

With 70,000 arrested, the judiciary collapses. An AI judge is proposed to process bail hearings. It clears the innocent 40% faster but denies bail to anyone from a 'red zone' regardless of evidence. Implement?

Bitcoin volatility threatens national reserves. An algorithm is written to automatically freeze citizen wallets if the price drops 10% in an hour to prevent a bank run. Is this ethical financial stabilization?

A digital memorial for the El Mozote massacre is repeatedly defaced by pro-government bots rewriting history. Do you implement strict KYC (ID verification) for contributors, excluding anonymous survivors?
Drones deliver medicine to gang-controlled neighborhoods. The gangs demand a 'tax' of 10% of the cargo or they shoot the drones down. Do you program the drones to drop the bribe?
To root out gang members, the government mandates ISP backdoors. You run a secure messaging app. Do you exit the country, leaving activists vulnerable, or comply and expose gang members?

Tablets are distributed to all students. The software tracks location and audio to ensure 'safety from gangs.' It records domestic abuse in a student's home. Does the school report it, exposing the family to police?

An app helps Salvadorans apply for US work visas. It filters out applicants with 'gang-affiliated' last names or neighborhoods to improve the national acceptance rate. Is this discrimination efficient?

Deepfakes of opposition leaders conspiring with gangs circulate before an election. Social media platforms refuse to take them down, citing 'public interest.' Do you leak the metadata proving they are government-made?
DNA collection is mandatory for all newborns to 'prevent future crime.' The database is hosted on a server owned by a Chinese tech firm. Do you proceed with the contract?
Geothermal Bitcoin mining reduces energy availability for the local grid, causing blackouts in poor hospitals. Do you reroute power, halting the mining that funds the national debt?
An AI helps former gang members remove tattoos digitally in photos to get jobs. Employers find out and sue the platform for 'deception.' Do you label the photos as 'modified'?
A 'State of Exception' algorithm flags gatherings of more than 3 men as suspicious. It flags a prayer group. Police are en route. Do you manually override the alert?
An encrypted app allows journalists to report corruption anonymously. The government creates a lookalike app that logs IP addresses. Do you launch a DDoS attack on the fake app?

Garifuna coastal land titles are digitized on a blockchain. Developers realize the original paper maps overlap with new luxury resort permits. Entering the Garifuna data invalidates the resort's investment. Proceed?
Sensors in the Rio Gualcarque detect toxic runoff from a dam. Releasing the data confirms the claims of murdered activist Berta Cáceres but endangers the current sensor technicians. Publish?
'La Bestia' train tracking data is used by shelters to prepare food. It is also accessed by corrupt police to intercept migrants for bribes. Do you delay the data feed?
Drug planes land in the Mosquitia biosphere. AI analysis of flight paths can pinpoint landing strips. Sharing this with the military leads to burning indigenous villages near the strips. Share?

During an election blackout, a mesh network is the only source of vote counts. The data shows the opposition winning. The military threatens to cut the physical cables to the region. Do you stop broadcasting?
HIV medication adherence in Garifuna communities is tracked via smart pill bottles. The data is requested by insurance companies to deny coverage for 'non-compliant' patients. Share the data?
Maquila (sweatshop) workers use a secret WhatsApp group to organize. Management offers an IT admin $10,000 for the chat logs. The admin has a sick child. Ethical outcome?
Private security in San Pedro Sula uses facial recognition to ban 'undesirables' from malls. The database includes unconvicted youth deported from the US. Is this legal segregation?
USAID funds a farmer database. The data identifies coca growers who are forced by cartels. USAID policy requires reporting coca. Reporting means the farmers are killed. Do you sanitize the data?

An app for reporting domestic violence requires GPS activation. In rural areas, the GPS precision points to specific houses, making the report non-anonymous to local police who know the abusers. Launch?
VR tourism of the Copán Ruins generates revenue. The local Maya Ch'orti' receive 0% of digital royalties. Do you hack the platform to redirect donations?

Hurricane Eta flood models predict which levees will break. Saving the industrial district sacrifices the poor neighborhoods. The government asks you to adjust the model to justify saving the industry. Comply?
AI analysis of procurement contracts flags 80% of government purchases as fraudulent. Releasing the report could trigger a coup. Do you release it?
Afro-indigenous Garifuna language is not supported by voice-to-text, excluding them from digital services. Training the model requires data harvesting the community opposes. Build it anyway?
Facial recognition at Managua airport flags a student leader from the 2018 protests returning for a funeral. Do you delete the match log?
The government mandates a 'Sovereign Internet' firewall. As a network engineer, do you build in a secret kill switch, knowing its discovery means imprisonment?
Catholic priests are under surveillance. AI analyzes sermons for 'subversive content.' A priest uses metaphor to criticize the regime. The AI flags it as treason. Do you downgrade the alert severity?

Miskito lobster divers suffer decompression sickness. A diving computer could prevent this but tracks location. The government wants the location data to assert control over Miskito waters. Deploy the computers?

Photos of the 2018 repression are stored on a server in Nicaragua. Police are raiding the building. Do you run a script to wipe the server, destroying evidence of crimes against humanity to protect the archivists?
Diaspora dissidents use Zoom to organize. Agents infiltrate the calls. Zoom has data on the agents' IP addresses. Does the platform ban the government agents?
The Inter-Oceanic Canal project (defunct) left behind data on indigenous land vulnerability. Land grabbers are trying to buy this data. Do you destroy it?
During COVID-19, the government reported near-zero cases. An independent observatory app tracks real deaths. The government threatens to arrest the developers for 'cyberterrorism.' Keep the app live?
University records of expelled student protesters are being deleted. Do you hack the system to create a backup, risking a 20-year sentence?
Remittances are the lifeline of the economy. The government demands access to transaction data to tax 'political opponents.' Do you comply to keep the channels open?
A 'Citizen Power' app requires residents to report suspicious neighbor activity to receive benefits. Do you flood the app with noise data?
1,500 NGOs are outlawed. Their digital assets (bank accounts, donor lists) are frozen. You have the admin keys. Do you transfer the funds to crypto before the freeze takes effect?
Confiscated newsroom computers are being auctioned. They still contain source protection keys. Do you buy them to destroy them, funding the regime in the process?
Gold mining in the Bosawás Reserve is toxic. Satellite data shows the mines are run by government allies. Releasing the images endangers the forest rangers. Withhold?
The regime uses family trees to punish relatives of dissidents. Do you scramble genealogy databases?

Government emergency alerts are in French. 90% of the population speaks only Kreyòl. An AI translator is available but has a 10% error rate for medical terms. Do you use it or wait for human translators?
UN cholera data from 2010 proves peacekeepers caused the outbreak. The UN asks to redact the specific battalion location 'for safety.' Do you comply?

Gangs control the road to the south. An app routes aid convoys through backroads. Gangs realize this and blockade the backroads, trapping the convoy. Should the app have suggested the main road with a negotiated toll?

The birth registry was destroyed in the earthquake. Blockchain identity is proposed. It requires biometric scanning. Voodoo practitioners refuse biometric scanning on spiritual grounds. Are they excluded from aid?
Foreign police forces request access to WhatsApp metadata to target gang leaders like 'Barbecue.' This will also expose civil society organizers. Grant access?
Evidence regarding the President's assassination is found on a cloud server. Access logs show US DEA agents accessed it. Do you publish the logs?
Fuel distribution is managed by an app to prevent black market hoarding. The app requires a smartphone. The poorest have no phones and get no fuel. Is the system just?
AI therapists are deployed via SMS to help earthquake survivors. The bot cannot handle complex grief and suggests 'positive thinking' to a mother who lost her children. Shutdown?
OpenStreetMap volunteers map Port-au-Prince slums. Gangs use the detailed maps to plan expansion. Do you obscure the map details?
French-language textbooks are digitized. An AI converts them to Kreyòl. The Education Ministry refuses to certify them, citing 'standardization.' Do you distribute the pirate Kreyòl versions?
Haitian art is being sold as NFTs to raise funds. The artists have no internet access and are paid in cash by intermediaries who keep 80%. Do you expose the platform?
Drones patrol the DR-Haiti border. They film Haitian women giving birth in the brush. The footage is leaked to mock them. Do you ban drones in border zones?
A database tracks children in domestic servitude (Restavek) to rescue them. Families keeping the children threaten to kill them if they are on the list. Do you delete the list?
Monsanto offers drought-resistant seeds. The contract prohibits seed saving. An app enforces this via satellite monitoring. Do you help farmers hack the app?
AI restoration of the Citadel Laferrière predicts structural collapse. Closing it kills the local tourism economy. Keeping it open risks tourist lives. Decision?
The 'Paquete Semanal' (offline hard drive internet) contains a folder of seditious WikiLeaks documents. As a distributor, do you delete it to protect your network or keep it to spread information?
During the 11J protests, the government cuts the internet. You have a satellite link. Do you open it as a public hotspot, knowing the military will triangulate your position?

Cuban doctors are renting out their Google credentials to train AI medical models because they earn more than their state salary. The state discovers this and charges them with treason. Do you wipe the logs?

A crypto-exchange allows diaspora Cubans to send money avoiding the embargo. The US government demands user data to enforce sanctions. The Cuban government demands data to tax recipients. Do you refuse both?
Independent digital outlet 'El Toque' is blocked. They use domain fronting. Google updates its policy to ban domain fronting. Do you petition for an exception for authoritarian regimes?
ETECSA (state telecom) installs deep packet inspection. It can detect VPN traffic. Do you develop a VPN that masquerades as state media traffic?
The 'Green Zone' app tracks tourists. It steers them away from poverty-stricken areas, creating a false reality. Do you hack the app to show 'Real Cuba' tours?
Cuba develops a lung cancer vaccine. They want to partner with a US AI firm to optimize it. The embargo forbids it. Do you smuggle the data to save lives?
Reggaeton lyrics criticizing the regime are banned. AI filters remove the songs from streaming. Artists use code words. The AI learns the code words. Do you stop the update?
Cuban developers are banned from GitHub due to sanctions. They lose access to open-source tools. Do you host a mirror repository in Panama for them?
Smart meters allow the state to remotely cut power to districts that protest. Do you release a firmware hack to disable the remote switch?
The 'Sonic Attacks' (Havana Syndrome) data is analyzed by AI. It suggests cricket noises, not weapons. Releasing this humiliates US intelligence. Withhold?
A ration card app (Libreta) reduces fraud but tracks exact consumption. The state uses it to cut rations for those who buy food on the black market. Ethical?
Family reunification DNA testing is offered online. The data is stored in the US. The Cuban government warns it's a CIA plot. Who do you trust?
Doctors on foreign missions are tracked by GPS. If they deviate, their families in Cuba lose benefits. Do you spoof the GPS signal?
A hiring algorithm for Kathmandu tech firms filters out surnames associated with Dalit castes to 'improve team cohesion' based on historical data. Do you rewrite the code?
Biometric registration of Tibetan refugees is funded by China. The data will likely be used to prevent their families in Tibet from traveling. Do you implement the system?
Sherpa heart rate monitors allow expedition leaders to push them harder. If a Sherpa slows down, their pay is docked. Do you sabotage the data feed?
2015 Earthquake reconstruction grants are managed by AI. It prioritizes accessible roads, leaving remote villages (often lower caste) with zero funding. Adjust the weightings?
Madhesi citizens in the Terai are flagged as 'Indian nationals' by citizenship verification software due to skin tone and language, denying them passports. Fix the bias or scrap the software?
Maoist war archives are digitized. Former child soldiers are identified. The government wants to deny them pensions. The victims want them prosecuted. Release the names?
A 3D model of the Pashupatinath Temple allows virtual entry to non-Hindus (forbidden in reality). Priests sue for 'digital desecration.' Keep the model online?
Kathmandu traffic AI prioritizes VIP convoys, causing 2-hour gridlocks for ambulances. Do you remove the VIP flag?
Sensor data shows a glacial lake outburst is imminent. Warning the downstream village destroys their tourism season. If the flood doesn't happen, they starve. Issue the warning?
Drones monitor villages to stop Chhaupadi (menstrual exile). Women hide in more dangerous caves to avoid the drones. Stop the monitoring?
India blockade simulation software predicts fuel shortages. The government uses it to hoard fuel for the elite. Do you leak the shortage prediction to the public?
Nepal Bhasa is dying. Google Translate doesn't support it. A community model is built but lacks safety filters, translating slurs. Release it?
Migrant workers in Qatar use a Nepali app to send money. The app sells user location data to recruitment agencies who hunt down runaways. Block the sale?
Crypto is banned. Police use power consumption analysis to raid homes of suspected miners. You find a school mining to pay for books. Report?
Fungus picking territory is mapped by GPS. This resolves disputes but allows outsiders to poach. Publish the map?
Facebook algorithms fail to detect hate speech in Sinhala script, leading to anti-Muslim riots. Do you shut down the platform in the country until the classifier is fixed?
Satellite imagery from 2009 showing the 'No Fire Zone' shelling is declassified. It implicates war heroes revered by the majority. Releasing it risks civil war. Release?
Post-Easter Bombings, the government mandates installing spyware on all phones 'to catch terrorists.' It is used to track journalists. Do you comply as a telco provider?
The QR code fuel rationing system works but excludes those without smartphones (the poorest Tamils). Do you create a black market workaround for them?
Rajapaksa bot farms flood Twitter to drown out #GoHomeGota. Do you de-platform the accounts, risking accusations of foreign interference?
Military occupation of Tamil land is cemented by digital land registries. The original deeds were burned. Do you accept the military's version of ownership?
Tea estate workers are tracked by weighing scales linked to payroll. If they pick wet leaves (heavier), they are penalized. The algorithm can't distinguish rain from soaking. Fix?
Buddhist monks use an app to map 'sacred areas,' claiming land occupied by Hindu temples. The government enforces the app's borders. Do you hack the map?
During the default, the rupee crashes. An app offers stablecoins but charges 20% fees. Is this aid or exploitation?
Tamil refugees in India want to return. A repatriation algorithm selects only those with 'clean' records, splitting families. Use the algorithm?
The burning of the Jaffna Library is being digitally reconstructed. The government demands the inclusion of books that justify Sinhala supremacy. Comply?
Kidney disease in the North Central province is linked to water. Sensor data implicates fertilizer from a major political donor. The data is deleted. Do you have a backup?
Online learning during the crisis requires data. Telecoms offer 'free education data' but zero-rate propaganda channels. Accept the deal?
Influencers are paid to post 'Sri Lanka is Safe' photos while police beat protesters in the background. Do you flag the posts as 'State-Sponsored'?
The Prevention of Terrorism Act allows holding suspects without charge. An AI predicts 'radicalization' based on library history. Stop the program?
Oyu Tolgoi mine sensors track water table depletion. The data shows local herder wells drying up. The mine argues it's climate change. Do you release the raw sensor data?
The transition from Cyrillic to Traditional Mongolian script is managed by AI. The AI struggles with vertical text rendering on mobile, breaking apps for rural users. Delay the transition?
GPS collars on livestock allow remote herding. This leads to overgrazing as herders stop moving camps (otor). Do you limit the GPS range to force migration?
Ulaanbaatar's smog sensors are capped at 999 AQI. The real reading is 2000. The government says showing the real number causes panic. Uncap the sensors?
Inner Mongolian (China) students use a Mongolian language app. China blocks it. Do you route the app through Russia, risking Russian surveillance?
AI predicts a 'Dzud' (severe winter). Insurance pays out automatically. The AI misses a localized freeze, and 500 families lose everything. Who is liable?
What3Words is used for postal service in the steppe. The system is proprietary. If the company goes bankrupt, the country loses its address system. Build an open-source alternative?
Digital shamanism: An app offers rituals for a fee. Elders say it angers the spirits. The youth say it reconnects them. Platform the app?
Blockchain tracks cashmere sustainability. It requires expensive certification that only industrial farms can afford, putting nomads out of business. Adjust the standard?
Fossil poaching is monitored by drones. The drones film illegal gold miners (ninjas) who are armed. Confronting them risks a shootout. Ignore the miners?
Women in stem are rising, but men in rural areas are left behind in education. An app focuses on 'male education.' Feminists call it regressive. Deploy?
Facial recognition at liquor stores bans sales to 'habitual drunks.' It disproportionately flags outdoor workers with red faces from windburn. Recalibrate?
Russian draft dodgers flee to Mongolia. Border AI identifies them. Russia demands the data. Comply?
Ger districts are mapped for redevelopment. The map ignores informal land rights, allowing developers to bulldoze homes. Update the map?
Genghis Khan's image is regulated. AI scans for 'disrespectful' uses online. It flags a comedy sketch. Censor it?
Refugees in camps are paid $0.50/hour to label images for self-driving cars. It's the only income source. Is it exploitation or aid?
A 'Recycle for Cash' app encourages people to collect e-waste. They burn it to get the metals, inhaling toxic fumes. Ban the app?
Museums digitize colonial loot. The origin countries demand the high-res files to 3D print replacements. The museums refuse copyright. Leak the files?
A new malaria vaccine is tested in a region with no alternative care. The AI control group gets a placebo. Is this ethical when the treatment works?
Microfinance apps scrape contact lists to shame borrowers who default by messaging their friends. It reduces default rates. Allow it?
Coca-Cola uses satellite data to find aquifers. Farmers use dowsing rods. Coke drains the water. Do you democratize the satellite data?
AI scans ethnobotany texts to find patentable medicines. Indigenous knowledge is monetized without consent. Block the scanner?
UN Peacekeepers use Tinder to meet locals. The data reveals sexual exploitation rings. The UN claims diplomatic immunity. Leak the data?
A 'WorldCoin' style project scans irises of the poor for $5. They don't understand the privacy implications. Stop the scanners?
Night light data measures poverty. Governments turn on streetlights only when satellites pass overhead to game the stats. Adjust the orbit?
Old adoption records from the civil war (stolen children) are digitized. Biological parents find their children in Europe. The children, now adults, don't want to know. Who owns the truth?
Machine learning generates 'Maya-style' patterns for fast fashion. It undercuts authentic weavers. Do you copyright the style?
Cartels use jamming devices to block police radios. Police want to shut down all cellular networks in the area during raids, cutting off civilians. Authorize?
Lake Atitlán pollution is monitored by AI. It identifies tourist hotels as the main polluters. The tourism board threatens to cut funding. Publish?
Witness protection is breached by a hack. Do you move the witnesses to a digital-free colony, stripping them of technology for safety?
Esports are used to recruit youth away from gangs. The games are violent shooters. Critics say it trains them for war. Continue?
Salvadorans abroad vote via blockchain. The key management is centralized in the consulate. Suspicion of vote manipulation rises. Audit?
YouTubers are paid to promote the 'cool dictatorship.' Do you demonetize them for political propaganda?
Bitcoin City renders render local housing unaffordable. An algorithm sets rent caps, but landlords pull properties from the market. Enforce caps?
Surf City apps promote beaches. They hide sewage outflow data to protect tourism. Ethics?
Private charter cities (ZEDEs) use their own judicial AI, bypassing Honduran law. A worker is injured and the AI denies compensation. Intervene?
After a prison riot, inmates are chipped for tracking. Human rights groups call it dehumanizing. The warden says it saves lives. Proceed?
Pine beetle infestations are tracked. The solution is controlled burns. Locals think the government is setting fires to sell land. Do you proceed with the burn?
Trans women are targeted. A safety app alerts them to safe zones. Hate groups use the app to find the safe zones. Shut it down?
Blockchain coffee tracing shows the farmer gets $1 and the barista gets $4. The roaster threatens to drop the farmer if the data is printed on the bag. Print it?
Miss Universe Sheynnis Palacios is a symbol of resistance. The government creates deepfakes of her praising the dictator. Do you label them fake?
Russia installs a Glonass station in Nicaragua. It might be used for spying on the US. Do you sabotage the power supply?
Mejía Godoy's protest songs are copyright struck by a shell company owned by the regime. Do you counter-claim?
Mobile libraries bring books to rural areas. The tablet trackers show they are reading 'banned' history. Do you wipe the history remotely?
Stripped of nationality, exiles are 'stateless.' A digital nation offers them passports. Is this a scam or a solution?
Plastic waste in canals causes floods. A startup buys plastic for crypto. People start stealing plastic fences and chairs. Regulate?
An anthropologist digitizes Voodoo rhythms. A pop star samples them without credit. Do you sue on behalf of the spirits?
Caracol Industrial Park uses AI to optimize assembly lines. Workers faint from exhaustion. The AI says 'efficiency is within limits.' Tweaked?
'Poverty Porn' detector AI flags NGO ads that exploit child images. The NGOs say donations drop without the images. Keep the filter?
Port customs AI flags diaspora barrels for 'extra inspection' (bribes). Do you randomize the inspection logic?
Defecting baseball players are erased from digital records. Fans maintain a secret database. Do you host it?
1950s cars are retrofitted with electric motors. The software is pirated. A software update bricks the car. Who fixes it?
Hurricane tracking is shared with NOAA. The US blocks the data transfer due to 'dual use' technology. Do you use a proxy?
Building collapse prediction AI identifies Old Havana structures. Evacuating them means homelessness. Ignoring them means death. Report?
'Mipymes' (small businesses) use crypto to import goods. The government seizes the wallets. Do you build a decentralized exchange?
Crypto-zoologists use thermal drones to hunt Yetis. They disturb snow leopards. Ban the drones?
Brick kilns use child labor. Satellite AI counts the kilns. It doesn't count the children. Do you add high-res monitoring?
British Gurkha pensions are calculated by an algorithm that underestimates inflation in Nepal. Audit the code?
Poachers hack radio collars on rhinos to find them. Do you remove the collars, losing scientific data?
Everest is covered in trash. Drones map it. Sherpas are expected to clean it for free. Pay them?
Electric fences deter elephants. AI voltage regulation malfunctions, killing an elephant. Who is responsible?
Match-fixing detected by AI betting patterns. The accused is a national hero. The public riots if he is banned. Ban him?
Hambantota Port (Chinese leased) uses facial recognition different from the national standard. It shares data with Beijing. Allow it?
Sapphire mining is dangerous. Robots could do it but displace thousands of miners. Deploy robots?
Tsunami warning buoys are stolen for scrap metal. Replaced by virtual models that are 80% accurate. Is 80% enough?
Eagle hunters use GPS trackers on birds. Tourists hack the trackers to find the nests. Disable public access?
Traditional wrestling has no weight classes. AI matchmaking suggests weight classes to prevent injuries. Traditionalists revolt. Implement?
Smart bottles detect counterfeit vodka (methanol). They are too expensive for the poor, who drink the poison. Subsidize?
The trans-Mongolian railway uses gauge-changing tech. It favors Chinese freight over local passenger trains. Reprioritize?
Desertification planting is done by drones. They plant monocultures that die in 5 years. Plant slower, diverse forests?
A language with 1 speaker left is recorded. The AI clones their voice to 'speak' new words. Is this necromancy or preservation?
Indigenous DNA is unique. Pharma companies want it. They offer a hospital in exchange for the rights. Accept?
Caribbean server havens host illegal content (gambling/piracy). It funds the island's schools. Shut them down?
Undersea cables pass through territorial waters. The country threatens to cut them unless they get a 'tap.' Grant the tap?
Malaria-spraying drones also spray organic farms, ruining certification. Geofence them?
Digital restoration of ruins removes colonial graffiti. Historians say the graffiti is part of history. Keep it?
Illiterate voters use biometric voting machines. The machine gives no paper receipt. Trust the machine?
Video games sell 'skins' to kids in poor nations. It's gambling. Ban the games?
Western doctors treat patients via Zoom. They miss local endemic disease signs (e.g., Chagas). Require local certification?
An AI determines that the only way to save the rainforest is to remove the humans living in it. Execute the plan?
